summary: septicaemia 16 (34.8%), secondary pneumonia 24 (52.2%), deep vein thrombosis 11 (23.9%), acute renal failure 9 (19.6%), acute myocardial infraction 8 (17.4%), stress hyperglycaemia 8 (17.4%), stress hyperglycaemia 8 (17.4%), pulmonary embolism 7 (15.2%), cerebrovascular accidents 4 (8.7%) and pneumomediastinum 1 (2.2%) one in five probable SARS patients required ICU care. the predictors for ICU mortality were male sex, APACHE II score > 15.
